alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Orange; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Orange, southern Caledonia and northeastern Washington Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy rain along a line extending from near Peacham to near Barnet to Wells River Village. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Very heavy rainfall SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding on roadways is likely. Locations impacted include... St. Johnsbury, Lyndon, Waterford, Bradford, Stannard, Topsham, Groton, Cabot Village, Lower Waterford, Fairlee, Lyndonville Village, Topsham Four Corners, Wells River Village, Ryegate, Cabot, Newbury, Newbury Village, Barnet, Groton Village, and Ricker State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 91 between mile markers 94 and 118, near mile marker 120, and between mile markers 123 and 138. Interstate 93 between mile markers 3 and 4, and between mile markers 6 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
